unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: Knowing which training jobs run and when helps attackers schedule their own GPU-intensive operations to blend in or steal capacity.
Awareness of job histories and logs enables adversaries to tamper with or delete evidence tied to compromised training workflows.

incidents.description: AI-assisted cloud intrusion achieves admin access in 8 minutes

securityImplications: Attackers might use ListTrainingJobs to discover datasets, container images, and execution roles involved in training so they can pivot to sensitive storage or tamper with future training runs.
